string.text: What do you want?
I have business with Jack, it's about Vano.
Get in, but don't stay too long!
Alright, I'm going.
I'd like to rifle through your shelves here.
Fuck no yer won't! Get the fuck outta here!
Do you know who would steal things from a personal locker?
I haven't seen it, so I don't know! Sorry, dear friend, I have my own worries... Untrustworthy people might be stealing your things, but evil people might want to take my life tomorrow...

Oh, where is the world going to... cheating, stealing, all around! Sorry, dear friend, I didn't see it, but I can tell you one thing: whomever stole it, he's already gone. These people are cowards, jackals, dear friend!
Let's go to Zulus.
Alright, I'll get on my way. I'll drop by Hawaiian to take a look at his goods and buy my suit.
Let's go.
I'm always happy to help you, dear friend! It's just that I'm reluctant do go during a blowout, you know? Let's wait a bit.
You need a suit with a closed-circuit breathing apparatus.

Woah, listen, dear friend, in my suit, you can go dive into a Fruit Punch and still breathe fresh air! Only problem is, the suit is still in Hawaiian's shop. I need to pay him back 5000, but I'm broke. Unfortunately, such suits tend to be expensive.
I could give you some money for your suit.
Listen, are you really a friend, or do you just want to scam Vano for some odd reason?
Here's 5000.
Woah! Listen, you're a real friend, saving me all the time! Just tell me where do you want to go, I'll take care of everything!
I would give you the money, but I don't have 5000.
Oh, my dear friend, this is nothing! And not shameful at all, it happens to everyone, I know that all too well...
I'll think about it.
But of course, think as much as you want. It's your money, right?
Oh dear, you're going to give it to me? Just like that?
I'm putting together a team to go to Pripyat. Want to go with me?
What kind of a question is that, my dear friend! You helped me - I'll help you!

Oh, my dear friend, I'd go with you, right here and now, but... listen, I'm saying this because I'm your friend: I can't leave here, not out of choice, but out of necessity. I want to live and if I don't pay back my debt, these dogs will shoot poor Vano...
Well, are you ready to head on to Pripyat?
Yes, Vano is all ready!
Welcome. So, what do you want from the lads?
Duty paid - get out.
They were unruly... I had to put them all down.
I paid them... you didn't give me enough.
Woah, my dear friend! Thank you!
Well, I had to also cover the interest.
That's sad, my dear friend... listen, thank you for your help. Vano will always remember.
I haven't visited them yet.
But, my dear friend! The more I delay my payment, the more money will they demand.
I looked around there, they were mentioning interest.

You bastards! Listen, I worked long and hard to put together that amount of money... Hey, do you have a good gun? If so, go to them and say that you're not going to pay the interest: they respect force and won't oppose you.
What is this necessity you are talking about?

Well, my dear friend, my story is thus: I had an old suit, all falling apart, with almost no protection. So, Vano thought that it's time to find a new one. I went and saw my new suit on sale, with a closed circuit breathing system, a beautiful thing... I counted my money, turned out I don't have enough, no matter what! The trader was about to sell the suit, when Jack came along. He looked at me, then at the suit and paid the remaining sum, so that I could get the outfit for myself. He said "Don't worry Vano, you'll pay me later." and I thought "Woah, a true saint!", but then...
Then what?

I sold my old suit and some other stuff I got, collected the money and brought it to Jack. He said "Well done, Vano! But where's my interest?". Vano thought that he was right, a man's not a good businessman, if he doesn't charge interest. So, I earned more money and brought to him, only to hear "Vano, your delay caused your interest to build up!" Well, I went and earned more money to pay him back, but it seems the interest was building up faster than I could earn cash. I had to pawn my new suit, my guns... Horrible.
What are you going to do?

I want to give them what I managed to amass so far, you know? No one will say even a single bad word about Vano! There's just this one problem, my dear friend: I'm afraid. I'm afraid that Jack will come up to Vano again and say "My interest, Vano, my interest...". If someone could just go instead of me and pay my debt...
Okay. I'll go.
Woah, my dear friend...! Look, if you are going to their base, keep your weapon out in the open, wave it in front of their faces, let them see that you're a man. That'll allow you to talk to them.
Alright, I understand.
Sorry, I'm busy as it is.
I've had enough.
Listen, can you go to Jack, my dear friend? Pay my debts?
Woah, stop, wait! Don't shoot, I'll give you... Oh, forgive me, dear friend, you startled me.
How is it going? What's up with the bandits?
Hello, my dear friend! Why, what a fine chap you've become!
Hello.
So, we have a guest! Look, a staker came, once again, to see Skullcap... So, what do you need? Some good advice? Or maybe a nice bargain? Go ahead, fire away.
I thought you would not come back ... Well, what do you come with?
What didn't we cover with you yet, stalker?
Whatcha want? Too much loot on yet back?
I need to see your boss.
Fuck no yer don't, ya mongrel! Get yet ass up and hit the road! Or maybe yer want to shoot me in yer ass to get ya goin'?
Alright, I'm going. Sheesh.
I'm here about the stalker you're keeping hostage.
Hmm... Well, head on in, just be sure not to cause any trouble, or we'll blow off yer ass. So, get in, go between the containers. 'stand?
I understand.
Just passing through and leaving.
I'm here about the stalker you're keeping hostage.
Yer still here? Blow off.
I see.
I see ya, loser... Yer want to offend us? No fee for hos-pee-tay-ley-ty? No ticket for leaving? Time to shave ya, loser.
You speak to your mother with that mouth? Get out of my way, I'm heading back to Yanov.
No look, asswipe! This lady here ain't goin' nowhere till ya pay for her! Now, empty yer pockets, fuckface! Empty them now!
Alright, here, take what you want.
Atta boy!
What? You want to take my stuff? How about I blow your face right off?!
I paid the ransom and I will do no more bargains.
Alright stalker, we've done our job. It's time for us to leave.
Thanks, guys. I'll see you later.
Stay a while longer, maybe some of the bandits are hiding somewhere.
Saddle up, everyone! Listen, we know how do our job, we did everything we could.
We're still not finished, stay sharp!
Understood!
Come with me to Pripyat.
I'd better stay here, watch Mityai, so that he doesn't get into any more trouble with his stupidity.
Hey, stalker! Listen, thanks for your help in getting Mityai out! We've got some guys, pooled our stuff and... Here, take this, it's from us all. Thanks.
Hey, stalker! Listen, thanks for your help in getting Mityai out! You're a real terminator: one against a horde of bandits... Here, take this, it's from us all. Thanks

Hey, stalker! Listen, thanks for your help in getting Mityai out! To be honest, I didn't really hope that you'd pay them all that money... Now, I think that you won't say no to a few more kopecks, so here, take this. It's from us all. Thanks.

Hey, stalker! Listen, thanks for your help in getting Mityai out. Turned out I was right, you can't stay on a bandit leash, you need to put pressure on them, be stronger... And you're one tough guy! Here, take this as a small token of our appreciation. It might not be much, but it comes straight from our hearts.
Well? When are you going to finish the job?
Working on it.
So, what's up? When are you going to put the pressure on those bandits?
Soon.
Did you change your mind? Or maybe the bandits did not cooperate? Listen, do what you want, but do it quickly, okay? We can't let Mityai die.
Just calm down, everything will be fine.
Stalker! I'm so glad to meet the master!
It's you... Oh, Mityai... We're worthless friends... couldn't help you.
I'm sorry, nothing could be done.
Come with me to Pripyat.
I came here to do stuff with my friends and I prefer to keep them company. Sorry,but I'm staying with my friends.
Welcome! Listen, thank you for helping Mityai! As I said, all we had to do was to pay the ransom! Now we have our friend back and no one got hurt in the process!
Welcome! Listen, thank you for helping Mityai! I heard that you were able to blow your way out of there. Well, since some of them survived, they'll probably wise up, at least in my opinion.
Welcome! Listen, thank you for helping Mityai! I was right, you did as I thought you'd do! Agreeing is always more productive than blowing off heads

Welcome! Listen, thank you for helping Mityai! I won't lie to you, I don't think your approach to the situation was the best. We're all humans, so in my opinion, reaching an agreement in these kinds of situations is best. Then again... the winner's always right, right?
You'd better go, I'm not in the mood for talking right now.
Alright, don't worry.
Hey stalker! I am pleased to see the master!
Mityai, you poor guy... You were just a kid, with so much life ahead of you...
We couldn't do anything...

Great, let's get ready. Bear already told me about you, so let me explain our plan. My boys will occupy positions on the perimeter. I'll take down their sentry and once I do this, we begin our attack. You are free to engage them on your own terms, just remember that we are also out there... so, ready to leave?
Piece of cake. Let's go.
Wait, I have a few loose ends to tie up.
Mityai, would like to see Pripyat with me?
Scientists want to hire a group of stalkers. Would you like to work for them?
What's the job?
They need protection for their bunker.
Sorry my friend, I had enough adventures with bandits! I'd better stay here and be safe.
You'll be taking measurements of the anomalies.
Hmm... this is interesting! I used to do do some sensitive work for them, and here you are now, offering me another job. Alright, we'll head to the bunker, me, Bear and Bags.
Tell me, how did you manage to get captured?

Oh, don't ask... I was a fool. Bandits said that next time, our meeting won't end well, unless I give them a cut, from all the loot I gather. They are really hard on loners in the Zone, but I was with my friends, so they were a little hesitant.

So, my friends and I threatened them with our guns and they dispersed. Well, I found out soon enough that they are really sneaky bastards. I was a fool, went out alone, just to rummage around a bit. They sneaked up on me, tied me up and... well, I'm here.
Thank you for buying me out! I owe you big time.
Thank you stalker for getting me out! I owe you big time.
Thank you stalker for buying me out!
Thank you stalker for helping me out!
Thank you for your help! My comrades will give you their thanks when we get back... Let's get going, it's a shorter way along the road.
OK, let's go.
You go, I'll catch up with you later. I have something to do here.
Stalker? I thought I was done for! Did Bear and Bags really hire that many people? It's the first time I see such a force! Uh, can we go now?
Have a little patience. Some of the bandits might have survived.
Yes. Let's go.
Stalker? I thought I was done for! ...Wait, did you go up against the entire gang alone? Oh man, you own! Heh, I can't believe you actually did that... Uh, can we go now?
Have a little patience. Someone might have survived.
Yes. Let's move out.
Thank you, brother! Let's get out as quickly as possibly, before the bandits change their mind.
Let's go.
Run - fast!
We cannot agree to the gang's terms. We need to force them to yield!
My thoughts exactly! I know guys around here, who are just itching to do this... Don't worry, we'll pay them. Question is, would you mind helping our team out there?
I am ready to go.
Excellent! There's this group of guys, ex-Mentovskie spetsnatz, they'll wait at the place we agreed upon. Get ready to go after sunrise: I was to appear there to negotiate.
Alright.
What Bags says is true. We can't go on a rampage as long as they have a hostage! We must agree to their terms.

Hmm... Maybe you're both right. But there's one problem: if me and Bags go, then the bandits will probably refuse to let Mityai go, suspecting that we won't play by their rules. They warned us, that if we tried anything, they'd tear out his throat. Now, if you agreed to be our middleman...
I see where this is going. Give me the artifact.
Just be careful out there, okay?
Everything will be okay.
Listen, you can argue here endlessly. But, your success depends on the person who will actually go out there and do something. Would you mind, if I went and sorted things out with these scum?
Wow... I did not expect such assistance. Thank you - and good luck.
I'll be back soon.
Alright. I need some time to prepare, though.
Stalker, please help Mityai, our friend! Get him out of trouble!
What happened to him?

Well, Mityai's their hostage... Bandits tried to establish their law here, demanding cuts from our brethren on all artifacts we find. At first, we sent them away, since, well, why should stalkers listen to the likes of them? Well, they left relatively peacefully, but did not change their minds. They ambushed the kid when he was alone, looking for loot, and are demanding ransom now.
What's the plan?

Bags wants to give them an artifact. I think we can't give them anything. See, if you give them a finger, they'll grab the entire hand and how fun will stalkering be, if bandits will just keep on harassing us? I think that we should sell the artifact, hire a few smart guys and hit their base hard.
Now, now....

So, do you want to help Mityai? Bags still wants to offer the bandits an artifact in exchange, while I'm standing by my idea to finally solve this problem once and for all, by destroying their hideout. Sell the artifact, hire guys... But, you see, there's two of us and neither will give up on his idea.
Are you ready? Look, we can give you an artifact to pay Mityai's ransom and wait here, at the bar, for you both.
How are you? Did you go to see the bandits?
Not yet, but I'm heading there.
I've been there, but achieved nothing so far. I'll call you when things become clearer.
I've been to the Oasis recently, and found an artifact there. Would you want it?

At the Oasis? Hah, stop pulling my leg! I heard many tales about the Oasis, but no one claimed that they've actually been there. Nice lie, but I'm not going to believe you, heh, even children wouldn't buy your tale.
I have some documents from the Jupiter plant.
Take everything.
Take the evacuation notice.
Take the transcript of the meeting.
Take the delivery schedule.
Take this note from the repair shop.
Maybe another time.
Who could steal things from a personal locker?
Not my men, obviously, maybe it was someone from Freedom. If Yanov was under our complete control, this would not have happened.
Tell me about Duty.
What exactly do you want to know?
What are you doing here?

Same thing as usual, defending stalkers from Zone filth. You've seen the mutants here, they're not your run-of-the-mill toothless Cordon dog. For example, I saw a chimera yesterday, with my own eyes. I regret that we weren't able to kill it, but chasing it around in the darkness... There are also other matters, such as preventing Freedom from breaking into abandoned labs and securing important materials inside before we do it.
What led you to the centre of the Zone?

Are you kidding? Well, let me return the question: what's your reason? I thing it's the same thing for all. Reaching the centre of the Zone was an impossible goal for years. Everyone is hoping to get answers to their questions, we would like to know how did the Zone came to be - and how can we destroy it. When rumours of the Brain Scorcher powering down started circulating, we moved out and are getting closer to getting our answers.
What did you manage to learn so far?

This is confidential information. I can only tell you that the Zone is not as simple as some say it us. Some of our men treat it as a kind of a tumour, which needs to be excised, but I, personally, think that the Zone is an entire living organism, and we are the microbes. I bet that even with the combined arsenal of all militaries of the world, we would not be able to destroy it, so we need to be smarter. Find the cause and fix it.
And if for some reason you won't be able to find and fix it?
Then we'll worry about what to do. Right now, we have a job to do. Everyone should fulfil their duties and hope for the best.
How did you end up as a Dutyer?

It's quite a sad story, without a speck of heroism in it. When the Zone emerged, me and my friend - Leonid was his name - decided to infiltrate it, find out what's what. I was a crane operator, while he became unemployed recently, so we had nothing to lose. Like fools, we have walked right into the worst place in the Zone, and ended up bleeding out in the middle of nowhere. Luckily, Dutyers came across us two and took us in. I made it through, but Lenka... I had no other friends outside the Zone, and my only one was consumed by this place. I decided to join Duty and stay, fighting against the Zone tooth and nail ever since.
What are your relations with Freedom?

Formally, we are at war, but near the centre of the Zone, life flows in a different way. There are very few safe spots here, and even fewer that don't have any Freedom in them. So, what would be the point of shooting each other each time we meet? Therefore, we have this unwritten rule: we play together peacefully in the sandbox. However, this rule only applies to Yanov. Outside its walls, the war rages on.
Forget it.
Well... alright.
There is a case. It's about a Freedom stalker, Flint's his name.
I don't give a damn about their stalkers, they'd better stay away from us.
Flint is Soroka, who screwed over hunters at the Creek, stealing their entire loot and slipping away while they fought.
So what? If you think I'm surprised, think again. He's a typical Freedom fighter.
I also met a stalker during my raids. He died, but managed to tell me how Flint threw him into an anomaly, just to get his loot and gun.
Now this I won't let go unpunished... Thanks for the information. Don't worry, we will set him straight.
I have enough dirt on him. For instance, he likes to credit himself with deeds of others. Mine, for example.
This will be a serious blow to Freedom's reputation. Thanks for the information, we'll use it accordingly.
No, nothing.
Your decision.
I have a PDA that belonged to Morgan, your quartermaster.
Agreed.
I'll think about it.
I agree.
I understand.
Let me look... So, this bastard has been running guns behind my back? Crap, if this goes out... Listen, I'll pay you for this find, let's say, 4000, okay?
This is a very serious accusation. Show me the PDA.
Here it is.

M-m-m... I did have my suspicions... Okay, we will deal with this matter properly. Thank you, stalker, and I hope that this conversation will stay between the two of us. Let me give you a small reward for saving Duty's reputation.
I lost it.
Another one... very interesting. Okay, I'll take it off your hands.
Here it is.
Thank you. Here, have a small compensation for your trouble.
I better hang on to it.
I met a group of fighters that wants to join Duty.
I could always use good fighters. Bring them here, so that we can talk about recruiting them.
There is one, small problem. They are former Monolithans.
Former? There is no "former" Monolithan. You are either a Monolith fanatic or you're dead - I've never seen a "former" nutcase.

But I did. It seems they were under some kind of mind control - they have no recollection of what happened to them after coming to the plant. They simply don't know what to do and show no signs of aggression.
No aggression, that's good... Generally, I'd find work for them, but I don't know if I can trust them. Can you vouch for them?
Yes. I trust them.
Hmm... The only problem is that I still can't trust you completely. Sorry.

Now, look. If you're wrong, I'll make you pay. But for now, the situation is that they can't come anywhere near Yanov without getting shot. Take a few of my boys, bring them to the Monolith squad, let them talk. If everything checks out, they'll become a part of Duty. Tell me when you're ready..
No, I do not trust them.
We do not accept just anyone who walks in through the door.
I am ready to take your boys to the Monolith squad.
Alright. You'll go with these two.
Alright.
Come later: I am busy right now.
Heh, listen, do as you like, but I'm not going to send my boys out during an emission!
I found a PDA, which belonged to Duty's founder. Are you interested?

Wow... Let me see it. So... that's how it really was... I think making this information public is not worth it, we should leave everything as it is - Duty's official version raises enough questions already. I'd like to buy this PDA from you.
OK, take it.
Excellent. Here's your payment.
I'll think about your proposal.
Here, I'll sell you your founder's PDA.
Thank you, you did us a great service. Here's your cash.
I need to find new employees for the scientists, can you help?
We are always happy to work for the scientists. What kind of help do they need?
They need a new security detail for the bunker.
Of course. I'll send my boys along.
Yes, of course. I'll send my boys along.
It wouldn't be a problem, but... They are already employing Freedom stalkers. Our presence there would only aggravate the situation.
I'm going to go to Pripyat. Could you assign a few of your men to me?
We have no free personnel available at this time... But you can go speak to the Rogue, he doesn't seem too happy about staying here.
We have no free personnel available at this time... Besides, I don't have the right to send my men on suicide missions.
Speak fast and get out quickly. What do you want?
Yes?
I'm glad to see you alive.
I have documents from the Jupiter plant.
What did you find there? The plant was stripped clean before we got here... Although... Wait, these are interesting... We ought to show these papers to people. Want to sell them?
Alright, take all of them.
Take the evacuation notice.
Take the transcript of the meeting.
Take the delivery schedule.
Take the note from the repair shop.
Perhaps later.
Who would steal things from a personal locker?
I can tell you didn't hire anyone to guard your locker, maybe you should? I can assure you it wasn't any of my people, we would not have accepted any stolen stuff.
Tell me about Freedom.
Now that's a long story. Ask away.
What are you doing here?

We are making sure that truth reaches ordinary people. We are stopping officials from keeping people in the dark. You know how it is: they find a new laboratory or documents that shed light on the mystery of the Zone... and bang, a military intervention comes, picks the place clean. So, the only way to learn something about the Zone and tell the people is to find it first.
What led you to the centre of the Zone?

We're sightseeing, boys wanted to look at all the new places... Just joking. The centre is a chance for us to learn more about the Zone and broadcast it to the world. After all, there are many places here, that remain untouched by soldiers or stalkers. Wherever you go, you find something new.
Did you find anything?
A couple of closed doors and a handful of weird artifacts.
How did you join Freedom?

Ah, that's ancient times... Even before the Zone's appearance, I was friends with future Freedom leaders. They were ordinary hippies, students, anarchists... When I came to the Zone to grab some artifacts, I saw familiar faces all around. So, I decided to hang out with my friends.
What do you think about Duty?

They are fools, that's what I think! Ask yourself, why the hell would they want to destroy the Zone? Nothing indicates that it's expanding. We should study it thoroughly, that's how scientific breakthroughs were made, by studying the unexplained! Humanity failed to create an anti-gravity device, but in the Zone, you're tripping over natural anti-gravity devices. Generally, we would drive them away and stop them from interfering, but they are too stupid to take the hint. By the way, do not let our coexistence at Yanov fool you - we are at war. This station is simply... how to put it... neutral territory.
Ah, okay. Forget it.
No problem.
There's a problem with one of your guys.
Yeah? Tell me. I just hope you didn't come to snitch on someone.
One of your fighters, Flint, is known as Soroka at the Creek. He screwed over hunters there and made off with their loot.
And you expect me to believe you, just like that?
Just listen to what he says in the bar! First he screwed stalkers over and now he's practically gloating about it.
Okay, do not get excited. I will talk to Beard, get to know the details. If he confirms your words - we'll deal with Flint appropriately.
Hmmm. I wondered how could he find an artifact this quick. I suppose he lied to me. Okay, I'll talk to him, if what you say is true - we'll deal with him appropriately.
Oh, nothing.
I see.
Agreed.
I'll think about it.
Here.
I understand.
I met a group of fighters, who want to join Freedom.
Well, we could always use some more good guys on board. If they want to join, they can come here.
There is a small problem. They are former Monolithans.
That's not a "small problem". I only look at Monolithans through my rifle's scope and I don't want it any other way.
They are peaceful, it seems they were under mind control, as they have no recollection of what happened to them after they came to the Chernobyl NPP. Now, they simply do not know what to do.
Sorry, but I cannot take your word for that. Did you really want to burden me with them?

Well... Talking to them can't hurt, and we can find out what's what. Okay, I'll send a couple of guys with you, to talk to them. If everything check out, they'll take the Monolithans and turn them into Freedom fighters.
Listen, just go, I have enough problems on my head!
I'm ready to guide Freedom's negotiators to the Monolith squad.
My people are ready, you can go immediately.
Good. Tell them to follow me.
A little later.
You'd better wait, the blowout, it can fry you brain. Uncool.
I found a PDA which used to belong to Duty's founder. Are you interested?

You can tell your fairy tales to three yea... Oh hell, that's some pretty interesting stuff! They preach their nonsense all over the Zone, while having a really dirty past... I'd like to research this PDA's contents, I'm ready to buy this PDA for hard cash, paid immediately.
Here, take it.
Thank you. Here's your money.
I'll think about it.
Here, take Duty's founder's PDA.
Thank you. Here's your money.
Scientists are looking for guys to work for them. Can you send someone?
Well, what kind of work?
Scientists need protection.
Yes, of course, I'll send some boys along.
Yes, of course, I'll send some boys along.
I'd gladly participate in this job, but Dutyers have settled there already. Living with them at Yanov is enough.
Could you give me a squad to help me get to Pripyat?
Talk to our newest fighter, Rogue. He's restless, maybe the two of you will find a way to the city.
If I had anyone I didn't need right now, then, perhaps, I would send them to you. Unfortunately, I don't have anyone, sorry. Everyone's busy here.
What do you come to me with?
What do you need?
Glad to see you, man! Only good news for you in Freedom. How can I help?
I found a strange object in the railway tunnel. Want it?
Um, no, not really, looks like garbage. Seems to be an artifact and all, but it has no properties. Scientists like to research this kind of junk.
I found a strange object at the Creek, are you interested?
Why should I be? I'm buying normal artifacts, and even those aren't my preferred type of goods. Take it to the scientists, they pay mountains of gold for such trinkets.
I am looking for people to protect the scientist bunker. Can you recommend anyone?

You won't find anyone better than Freedom, though you can try negotiating with loners, but they are unreliable - if they decide to go away, where will you find them afterwards? At any rate, I wouldn't recommend Duty - these fanatics are only useful as mutant exterminators.
I am looking for people to carry out measurements for scientists. Can you recommend anyone?
Of course. Go to Loki, I think he'll be happy to help you. You can always try to negotiate with loners, but they tend to be very unreliable.
Someone stole stuff from my locker, do you know who could have done it?

That's horrible! Dutyers aren't a likely suspect, since they are extremely disciplined... a bit too much for my tastes. Freedom on the other hand, wouldn't need your stuff. So, it must've been a loner.
I've met a group of Monolith fighters recently.
Wow! Now that's something I haven't heard. Most stalkers tell stories about them over a glass of vodka, that they have ice in their veins or go completely inside. Were they hard to kill?

I didn't have to kill them, they were peaceful. They told me that the veil was lifted from their eyes... That all they did was beyond their control. Their leader asked me to find them someone, who could take them in, as they have no idea what to do now.

Wow... Now that's something... Well, they can't just become regular stalkers, as I doubt others will appreciate their... past achievements. Try talking to Loki - in Freedom's outfits nobody will touch them.
Who would be interested in finding out the truth about Duty's founder?
I don't know. It depends on how much it differs from propaganda Duty's smothering us with. Go to Loki, might be interested in it.
I have a PDA here, which used to belong to Duty's quartermaster. Want it?
What for? Everything he has, I have and can get more at low prices. Besides, there's nothing really interesting there.
Who would like to go with me to Pripyat?
To Pripyat? Well, what can I say, I can and would go, as in the good old days, but I have too many things to look after here...
To Pripyat? Well, what can I say... go ask Loki about this, I think he won't refuse a nice guy like you.
Want something refreshing? I've got regular drinks, premium hospitality and top-notch cordiality!
My place is like Greece - I've got everything! What's your need? Food, drink, guns?
I am looking for people that can protect the scientist bunker. Any advice?
Talk with the stalkers. I think they won't be adverse to the idea of working for the scientists. After all, each one will receive an official Zone pass.
I am looking for people to carry out measurements for the scientists. Any advice?
I'd advise you to rule out inexperienced stalkers immediately. They won't do much, but will lose a lot. And then I'll have to patch them up.
I met a Monolith squad recently... and I need your consult.
You know, those who met Monolithans usually end up brought to me with a few extra holes in them. However, you're still standing on your feet. What do you want to know?
See, they weren't insane. I mean, they talked to me, instead of shooting.
You're joking!
Nope. They said that the shroud that covered their minds disappeared, and that they do not know what to do now. So, I need your advice.

What can I say... Tell them to stay away from stalkers, the painful memories are still vivid... Perhaps one of the factions can take them in, although I am at a loss as to whether they will prefer Duty or Freedom to talk to them.
I have a PDA with the truth about the founder of Duty. Interested?

I'm not interested in gossip, remember that. If you want to sell that information, go to Owl, it's his speciality. However, the nature of this information makes me think that both Loki and Shulga would like to get this PDA.
I have a PDA that belonged to Duty's quartermaster. Want it?
I feel this PDA will get me in trouble with Duty, and I do not want that. Try Owl, he might be more interested.
I need medical help.
Well, let me take a look ...
Alright, you're fixed.
Who would like to go with me to Pripyat?
Talk to Vano. He is an honest fellow, though he always gets into all sorts of unpleasant situations.
You know, there aren't many people here crazy enough to go to Pripyat.
You need drugs, a chat or both?
Someone stole stuff from my personal locker. Do you know who could have done this?
Do you know this stalker's name?
I heard that he arrived recently... What was his name... Something like "Smug", "Smegma"... No, it's not that, let me think... Snag! Yeah, the stalker's name was Snag!
Hello, brother.
Hello. I have a great deal for you.
About time a serious matter arose, sit down and let's have a drink!
Well, let's drink!
No, I'm not in the mood for drinking.
So, tell me, what's the deal?
I'm going to go to Pripyat, through the underground path under the Jupiter factory. Nitro can open the entrance to it.
Hmm... Go through the Pripyat underground.... Now that's an idea! And good ideas need to be followed by a toast.
Cheers.

Ah, that hits the spot. So, you're going alone, on such a journey? No... this won't work. I'm coming with you, and I need some more people too, even a pair of reliable stalkers can't face this sort of situation alone.
Nitro told me to gather a squad.
That's right. Let's have a drink, for that matter!
To you.
I can! I did it at the Creek, single-handedly destroyed the lair of bloodsuckers.
That's a fine job, comrade, I respect that. For hunting!
For hunting!
Reliable... I came across real swine lately. Meet the bastard at the Creek he was a Dutyer...
Well, it was a matter of time before Duty starts rotting. What has the world come to... Come on, let's have a drink.
True. Drink up.
Oh, chilled... Nitro is correct. We need at least three people to come with us... Can you think of anyone?
Nope. We also need suits with a closed-circuit breathing apparatus.
Yes, safety first. Hmm, about the equipment... I'm all set, I have the necessary suit. But the rest will need them too and they aren't too common around here. Here's to a successful search.
OK, bottoms up.
Do you know this eccentric, Noah? Spends his time locked in a barge with a bunch of wacky ideas... Instead of saying "hello", he pulls out a shotgun.
Yes, I do... Been quite a while since I saw him. He was a good soldier, we fought side by side once... A pity he went insane. Let us drink to his life.
To him.
There's this case here... I met Vano at Yanov, he couldn't pay his debt to the bandits, so I helped him.
We'll have to take him for the ride - everything is always fun when he's around. Let's drink to Vano!
Bottoms up!
There's this soldier, stranded at the scientist bunker... Maybe he'd be willing to join us?
Well, a soldier could come in handy. Let's drink to him agreeing to join us.
Let's drink.
Imagine, I helped a squad of Monolith recently. Their brains straightened out and they did not know what to do. I managed to find them a job with the factions, they're at Yanov now.
Ahem... Vodka's a little strong, I guess... Maybe you should drink just half of what you usually do. Let's try.
Alright.
We also need to make sure we don't get lost in those dungeons.
Don't worry about that, I have a map.
Great! Let's drink, so that everything turns out the right way. Cheers!
Cheers!
Now, see this... I found the Oasis recently! The one place nobody could find a road to.
Well, you pathfinder! With such skills, we'll get to Pripyat in no time. Bottoms up.
And down it goes....
Cool!
I think we have enough fighters. We can go.
Are you sure? An extra pair of hands can't hurt.
I'm sure. Let's go.
You're right. I'll try to find more people.
Nice. Attention! Time to get off our asses and move!
Let's go.

Fighters, fighters... You care about my help? Then come back when you have a suit with a closed-circuit breathing system, I'm not going to drag your ass on my back when you collapse. A machine gun with half a ton of ammo is enough.
OK, I understand.
No matter what we're planning... We'd better stay here for now, at least until the blowout passes.
Where can I find men for our squad?

Ask stalkers around here, near Jupiter. I bet nobody at the Creek will be willing to go. We need men that will hold their own... Who you can convince to go on a suicidal raid, in fact. Maybe you recall someone? Someone you helped and wants to repay his debt, or is your friend...
A few competent fighters will be enough, I'd rather you didn't collect an entire division. Squad tactics, you know.
What do you think about Rogue?
Monolith members are usually fanatical, violent men. But former Monolithans... See, Rogue is calm on the outside. I feel that it's a mask of some sort.
Not bad, a Monolith SEVA... Where did he get such a rare trophy?
He got it. It's Rogue, the former Monolithan.
Don't be so quick to say "former". Okay, look, I'll let him prove himself.
What do you think about Sokolov?
He has an interesting combat suit, scientific. It's been a long time since I've seen one of these, two years, I think.
That's Sokolov, co-pilot of the crashed military helicopter.
Well, I could guess that he wasn't a scientist from his behaviour. A good soldier is always useful.
Are you familiar with Vano?
We met a couple of times in the "100 Rads" bar. They say he's an honest guy, an optimist and a great stalker to boot... But too trusting. The Zone is merciless to those.
Oh, Vano's with us. Good, we'll have someone to feed to the bears... Hey, don't get offended, man, I was joking.
Who could steal things from a personal locker?
You were robbed? Not a pleasant situation, I bet. I don't know what to say, I didn't see anything suspicious. If I knew anything, I'd tell you, as a rat in the base always results in a big mess.
People said that there was a shooting here recently...

Yeah, I'm a guy who likes silence. Some assholes decided to organize rallies near the tower... They've been yelling about not sharing something or some such. I'm a machine gun operator, so I ended the rally... They ran towards the train station.
I decided to give you the Oasis artifact.
That is a very wise decision. Please, bring it here.
Here, take it.
OK... hmmm... I'm surprised... I must study it as soon as possible. Oh, yes, thanks for finding it, here's your money.
Need any help?
Thank you for the offer, but we already have a stalker squad helping us. Although... there is one theory, more of a legend, actually. Did you hear about the Oasis?
I can see where this is going... Yes, I'll try to find the Oasis.
Sorry, but I have too many things to do right now.
No, I am not familiar with the name.

Then listen. Many talk about it, but it seems no one has actually been to it. It's apparently a reservoir of healthy water, that heals all of your wounds and restores strength if you submerge yourself in it. Some argue that the Oasis is just something stalkers dream of. Since I'm a scientist, the question "What is the Oasis, exactly?" comes to my mind instantly, so I'd like you to look for it, if you'd be so kind. I can't pay you much, but if you find it - assuming it actually exists - you can help us achieve a breakthrough in our research.
I found the Oasis.
Oh really? It actually exists? Do not consider me a killjoy, but did you bring something from it?
Here's something I found there, looks like an artifact.
Well, bring it here immediately!
Here, take it.
Yes, but, surprisingly... I must study it as soon as possible. Oh, yes, thanks for finding it, here's your money.
I'll consider that. I find it useful.

That's very selfish on your part. And dangerous, since that artifacts exact properties are unknown. What would you do, if you'd lose your legs tomorrow? Or, say, your skin turned green? Let me give you this advice: you'll be better off giving unknown objects to us, scientists. We, at least, have the proper equipment to handle them.
Do not try to scare me into giving you the artifact, it stays with me.
Okay, take it, I understand your point.
No, I did not.

How could you come to me with empty hands? What am I supposed to study...? Do you know why us scientists are different from the rest of mankind? Because we expect any theory to be backed up with facts! And to get facts, I need proof!
Alright, I'll go there again.
I wasted too much time on this job already. I'll do it later.

If you don't want to go for the sake of rewards, think about the opportunities for medicine! If I'm not mistaken, the Oasis is an anomaly, unique both to and in the Zone. If the stories are true, then this would be the first anomaly to have actual healing properties!
What brings you to us?
Did you see the mercenaries that guarded our bunker?
Oh, how nice it is to see an intelligent man. How can I help?
Just imagine, the mercenaries who guarded us were killed! Right outside the bunker!
Do you know anything about the Oasis?
Oasis? Ha! It's a myth. People want to believe that a panacea exists for all of their ailments, so they weave tales about such things... Rest assured, the Oasis is nothing more than fiction.
Many people talk about it.
Yes, but none of those have actually seen the place. I'll stick to empirical science - what hasn't been proven to exist, does not exist.
Fiction, eh? I see.
Good. Let's go.
Here, champ... We'll get back fast, you won't get homesick.
We'll see.
Alright. Let's just wait for the emission to pass and then we can go, OK?

Good day, stalker, I'm Uncle Yar. I suppose you're tired after your journey? Here, have some grub, it's good for you... No heroic stuffs can be done without food... Listen, I need two pairs of strong hands, can't do it alone, I'm not young any more. Then again, I remember the good old days...
Hello, stalker, resting after the trip? Now, can I chat with you for a moment? Uncle needs your help...
How's your young life? I see you're getting stronger every day...
What do you need?
A little something. We'll go, just the two of us, to Kopachi, it's not far from here. Then, you'll see what I need...
Why me? Can't your fellow Freedom fighters help?
I can't bother them with such a trivial, simple job... Surely you and I, two grown men, are enough?
Want to come with me to Pripyat?
No, not really... I would, if I was younger - I remember when I reached Siberia on foot once, but now... I guess my bones just aren't as strong any more.
Good luck.
Wait. You're going to Yanov, right? Maybe we can go together? Talk about this and that...
Thank you, but I have other matters to attend to.
OK, let's head on to Yanov.
Thank you for helping your uncle... Take this small present. And, if you want, you can ask me questions now. I'll answer as best I can...
Why didn't you ask Freedom fighters to help you?
And make the mercs come after Freedom? We already have a war on our hands, one that eats away at everyone. This was a private matter, I couldn't mix my fellow Freedomers into it, you understand.
What were they doing there?

They came to kill me. I had this encounter with them... I was sitting in the bushes, minding my own business, when a detachment of mercenaries came. They passed by, their leader was chatting with someone on his PDA. About the lab in Pripyat, a central one, a rush order... I got my old bones moving and started creeping away, but then, I stepped on something - a fresh apple. When it crunched, I just grabbed my sniper rifle tight and made a run for it. However, I knew that I saw too much and had to be taken out, so I had to be faster than them...
Now, do not be surprised. Come over here slowly, if you stay quiet and still, we'll be all right.
Okay.
I need to get out of here. We'll talk outside, in fresh air.
OK.
I'm putting together a squad for a hike in Pripyat. Want to go with me?
It's tempting... but no. Scientists promised me a Zone pass and they pay well. Sorry, but I'm staying here.
Are you ready to conduct measurements of the anomalies?
If you can cover us, we're always ready. Which anomaly do you want to check?
We'll go to the Smoothie.
The Ashes, at Kopachi.
None, I changed my mind.
Yes, we are ready. No, we aren't going out during a blowout. Wait until it passes.
I see.
We've finished taking the measurements, let's move on.
I don't feel like hanging around here for too long. Where shall we go?
We'll go to the Smoothie.
Let's go to the Kopachi village, to the Ashes.
Back to the scientist bunker.
Wait, let me think.
Ready to head back to the bunker?
You can't imagine how.
Let's go then.
Well, wait for me a bit.
I have a couple of questions for you.
Ask, I'll answer if I can.
That is all.
I have a question about this scientist assignment.

You want to know about this tunnel, yes? Well, there must be something inside, an artifact or some such... It's a really strange place. At first, everything was quiet, but then, the brain hurting began... Oh, and it might still be full of tushkanos, but do not worry about that, we'll make short work of those rodents.
You've been here before?

Yes, but we did not go too far in. Just took the measurements for Herman, when a horde of tushkanos came... When these two scientific geniuses saw the results, they started to make theory after theory. Wanted us to go and search the whole tunnel, but I told them off, I'm not suicidal. Well, now they've hired you, so...
I see.
Well, it's not my first time taking measurements. We'll manage.
Where were you taking measurements before?

Well, that's saying much. We were supposed to measure the psionic field inside the tunnel, but when we switched on the devices, we were swarmed by tushkanos, coming out through cracks in the wall... You can see that it's not a nice place.
Don't you find this strange?

No, not really. Everything's in order, the Zone doesn't like when you meddle in her affairs. This is something Ozersky said to me, something that's completely true. You could go and ask him about that. He might know something he's not telling us.
Alright.
I see.
What can you tell me about the inhabitants of the bunker?

We have quite a company here... Two scientists, Herman and Ozersky, with Novikov, hired as a technician, and Garik, a guide. Well, we are here to take measurements for the scientists and any other nonsense they come up with. Oh yeah, there's also the soldier Garik dragged in recently.
Can you tell me more about Herman?

Herman's in charge here, he seems to be a professor. I've no idea what institution does he represent, but I bet it's something secret. He organized this expedition, their bunker was air dropped in here practically overnight, as the Brain Scorcher went down. He hired us on the same terms as Garik - good pay and, eventually, an official Zone pass.
Let's talk about something else.
Can you elaborate on Ozersky?
A nice guy, likeable, but he's always number two, even though Herman listens to him from time to time. I don't know much about him. Hey, Herman's in charge, after all.
Can you tell me about Novikov?

I'll tell you - that man is Einstein on vacation. He has solid golden hands, when it comes to technology, making one of a kind technical thingamajigs you won't find anywhere else. No one knows how did he manage to get to the scientists, but one thing is obvious - he's not a stranger to the Zone, on the contrary, he knows much more than what he's telling us.
Can you tell me about Garik?

Garik is a great guy, he was one of the first to come to this place. He told me that he managed to catch the moment when the scientists landed here and get them to hire him. Now, he stays here, bored out of his right mind. He is restless by nature, but his contract with the scientists keeps him here. I think you'd be better off just asking him about it.
Tell me about the soldier.
Ha! Garik found the soldier when he was hunting zombies. The guy was lucky to be found, since not many go to the old base. Now he's sitting in the bunker, doesn't even stick a finger out.
What can you tell me about the mercenaries?

Those guys guarding the bunker are regular thugs. They came here recently, wanted to talk to Herman. They ended up staying here, and it seems that Herman's not too happy about it. Their chief is called Black, reflecting his attitude.
What can you tell me about the local places?

Among the local sights there's an abandoned military outpost, just over this ridge to the south. To the north lies the Kopachi village, and east of it - the station where the stalker camp is located. It's a miniature city in an abandoned train yard.
Tell me about the military outpost.
It's nothing special. What can I say - it's abandoned, mutants and zombies are the new owners... Oh, yeah, there is a bunker there. It's small, but you can hide from a blowout there.
Tell me about the village.

Village only by name, there are just some sand mounds there now. It was buried back in '86, to prevent it from being a radioactive hot spot. Well, they didn't really succeed, it's an awful place now, devoid of anything of value.
Tell me about the station.
Which place?

It's an old station named Yanov. If you haven't been there yet, make sure you check it out. You can get a nice, cold glass of vodka there and chat with your fellow stalkers. It's also the only safe place here, apart from our bunker.
I see you have some new equipment.

Damn right! We are now officially called the Scientific and Operational Research Team "Glint"! Now, you might think that we, as junior researchers, have forgotten how you'd cover our asses in the past, but that's not true. In fact, we talked about it and... Here, take this, it's a token of our appreciation. When you go diving in anomalies or, God forbid, a blowout catches you - remember this. We do not forget about those who helped us out.
Hello.
Hello.
So, are you ready to go?
I thought I'd remain a brainless tunnel zombie forever! How can I help my saviour?
Well, how about a warm up?
Hello, brother.
You know - I owe you one. I won't forget this.
Looks like we don't have a reason to stay here, let's get a move on...
Tell me what's in that tunnel?
There's no dust in there. Herman said it's because of the Tesla flying around in there, but I'm sceptical.
Some sort of large interference... You don't know what's real and what's not in there.
Did you find anything while measuring the psi-fields?
I saw footprints on the floor, looked human, but, well, that human would have to be barefooted... Wonder who would be stupid enough to walk barefooted in this place?
Somehow, the ceiling starts spinning and everything just shakes all around you. Fucking psi-field... Got my point?
What did you find underground?
Oh, nothing, a couple of tushkano carcasses, nothing much.
Hmm... Nothing I wouldn't find elsewhere in the Zone.
How are you holding up?
I'm fine... thanks to you. Here are coordinates for a cache, feel free to take everything from it. It might not be much, but, well, treat it as a small token of gratitude.
How are you feeling?
Man... My deepest thanks. Without you... Hell, I have no idea what would've happened to us. Heh, I'll give you the coordinates to our hiding place, as a token of our gratitude.
You alive?
Thank you, I won't forget what you've done. I've decided that... You can have the coordinates to our hiding place, treat it as a gift.
How's your brain?
Damn, what I saw was... It'll be hard to shake this.
Well, how about we head back in the bunker?
Home, home, my dear friend!
Then let's go.
Go ahead, I'll meet you there.
Are you ready to go into the tunnel?
Any time.
Then let's go.
Wait just a moment longer.
I will go myself. See you there.
I will go myself. See you there.
Hardly. You are unreliable, and our time is money. So, either you're going with us or we're not going anywhere.
Then we can go together right now.
Then you'll have to wait.
What, now? The blowout hasn't passed yet.
Well, here we are, this is the place.
Well, can we begin?
Yes, of course.
I'll have a look around.
Hey, you! Forgot something?!
Just passing by.
Well, move yet ass then, keep goin'.
Alright, I'm going. Sheesh.
You don't have the balls to make me go, fuckhead.
It's none of your business!
Oh... Hello.
Nimble told me that you lie... None of the stalkers confirmed your story either.
You crazy? I've never stolen in my life! Nimble's insane!
What did you tell the bandits about me? Why were they waiting for me at the port cranes?
You must've confused me with someone, I've never had any dealings with the bandits!
Nimble told me about you... Now, hand over the gun before I get angry...
What? That's impossible, I have nothing that would belong to you!
Oh, fuck you...
Please, brother, give me a first aid kit, I beg you.
Now, now... First, tell me where is my stuff!
Sorry bro, I needed the money...! I'll tell, just please, please, please help me! I'll tell you, no more lies, just please, I beg you, help me...
You're pathetic. Here, have a first aid kit.
Oh, thank you my friend! I hid the loot in my secret place, in the train station sewer.
Alright.
I trusted you one. I won't make the same mistake. You're not getting any aid.
Here.
Nope.
Thank you. I didn't think you'd help me ...
Who can I hire to protect the scientists?
Well, Duty, of course. They are the best fighters in the Zone! Besides, I think they'd appreciate some 'heavy duty' protection, don't you think?
Hmm, with Freedom working for them? No idea. I'd say Duty, but it's generally a bad idea to put those two groups together.
Who can I hire to conduct measurements for the scientists?
Try talking to Shulga. Of course, he might not have any quantum physics graduates, but there are a few brighter guys in their ranks.
Hmm, are they still under Freedom's protection? Well, Duty's certainly out of the question, then... No one else comes to my mind.
When we got into the underpass, the elevator died.
Ha! The generator I used to power the elevator was working fine... on reserve. It's completely dead now, you should be happy it didn't fail halfway down... It has no emergency exits.
Who could steal things from a personal locker?
That's some nasty business! Hmm, I have no idea, but let me say this: if Lieutenant Colonel Shulga was in charge of Yanov, this would not have happened.
Can you break a steel container open?
Well, I'm not a safe cracker. Not used to bashing things open with a piece of iron, my dear sir, come back if you have something electronic to crack.
Peaceful Monolithans are looking for someone to take them in, can you suggest anything?

Are you serious? They say Monolith fanatics are like rabid animals... Well, becoming regular stalkers is out of the question. I think you can try talking to Shulga, if he agrees to take them in as Dutyers, then they will be safe from uncomfortable questions. Besides, they'll have a stable job.
Can you decrypt a black box?

Let me take a look... Hmm, this might give me some trouble... I'll need about... Three hours. As for the cash... This kind of work is expensive, we'll talk about the payment when I'm finished with it. Now, you just go for a walk, okay? This is a precise job and I can't be interrupted...

Let me take a look... Hmm, this might give me some trouble... I'll need about... Three hours. As for the cash... This kind of work is expensive, we'll talk about the payment when I'm finished with it. You can look for those radio materials in the meantime, OK? That'll make the decryption cheaper and easier to do.
Huh, what? Hey, I'm working on it, shit, man, it's a black box, not a CD player...
I'm finished with your box... A piece of cake, to be honest. Heh, why did I even think it wouldn't be...
How much?
3000, no less.
Here, take it.
I don't have enough cash.
Look, I can lower the price if you bring me those radio materials.
Well, if that's that - I'll go.
Too expensive ... I'll think about it.
I'll make a discount, just for you. 2850.
I'll make a discount, just for you. 2700.
I'll make a discount, just for you. 2550.
I'll make a discount, just for you. 2400.
I'll make a discount, just for you. 2250.
I'll make a big discount, just for you. 2100.
I'll make a big discount, just for you. 1950.
I'll make a big discount, just for you. 1800.
I'll make you a personal offer, minimal wage, just the materials. 1650.
Heh, I have no idea why you wanted this data, but I hope it's useful, since that was a lot of cash.
Later.
I'm working on your box... Listen, instead of hanging over my shoulder, you could look for those materials I need.
Him? He kind of stuck to me while I was still at the Creek... A drunken master, with a lot of "experience". I use him for fed-ex jobs, like getting me parts or delivering small packages.
Who could be interested in information about the founder of Duty?

Shulga, of course... Duty remembers its roots, as those who do not know history are doomed to repeat it. On thing is certain, it cannot reach Freedom, they are going to invent something ugly with that information, malicious bastards they are.
I brought you the tools.
Oh, now that's class... Which ones?
For rough work.
Excellent! Now I need two more sets: for fine work and for calibration ...
For fine work.
Excellent! I need two more sets: for rough work and for calibration...
For calibration.
Excellent! I need two more sets, for fine and rough work...
Not right now.
Classy! I just need tools for calibration and I'll have everything I need for my upgrades.
Classy! I just need tools for fine work and I'll have everything I need for my upgrades.
Classy! I just need tools for rough work and I'll have everything I need for my upgrades.
Wow! Give them to me... Where did you manage dig them up in this place...
If you don't have the tools, I can get them for you.

It would be cool, since I currently feel like a caveman, with a soldering iron instead of a shaman staff. If you bring me them, I'll be able to make you some first class upgrades, and you'll get some coin out of it as well.
Sounds good, I'll have a look around.
I changed my mind.
Come on, it'll be good for you, I'll be able to do upgrades and you'll get cash!
I have a PDA, which used to belong to Duty's founder. Who might be interested in it?

Duty's founder? Now that's some strong stuff you've got there... Give the PDA to Shulga, he'll sort things out. Just don't give it to Freedom, OK? They are likely to freak out over this stuff, if it allows them to shred Duty's reputation.
I found some documents that speak about a way into Pripyat.

Let me take a look... Hmmm... Uh-huh, uh-huh... I see... Hm, basically, there's an underground transport passage, going near Pripyat. One of its sections is accessible through an elevator in Jupiter's main factory hall. Cool! One problem though, according to the documents, the pass was sealed, filled with gas and shut down. I could try to restart the generator and open the gateway to the passage, but...

...but without proper protection, I won't do it, I can't let you go there just to suffocate. Oh, you should also get a few good men to go with you underground, all with closed-circuit breathing systems or they won't last a second down there... Look, try talking to Zulus, he's lives in the tower near Yanov. If he likes you, he'll help you organise a team.
You were talking about some materials ...

Yes, it's really easy to work with radio tech around here. Everything's busted and what's not, dies soon afterwards and no one carries radio parts, guns are far more profitable... I did hear once, that there's some radio stuff left in the old cement plant...
I got those materials, here, take them. I scoured the plant from top to bottom.
Well, brother, you rule! Let me note down that I should give you a discount on all of my deals.
I managed to get some of the materials. Here, take them.
Wow! Well, that's a discount for you!
I can bring you the materials.
Cool! If you find anything, resin, transistors, hell, even textolite - bring it all here. I might not be able to pay you, but I will give you a discount on all of my services.
Why do you need those materials?

I fix guns and armour, anything you want me to. But, my real passion is radio technology. Can you imagine how good it feels to assemble something and see it work? I remember a jammer I made once... Useful gadget, I used it every time the "100 Rads" megaphone kept waking me up, to shut it up.
Why would radio materials remain in a cement plant?
It's a cement plant just by name. It was shut down before the first Chernobyl incident and an electronics workshop was established in the abandoned building.
I found some documents at the Jupiter factory, can you take a look?
Hmmm... Nothing interesting, just your usual administrative babble...
Hmm ... There is some interesting info in here, but I can't give you any specifics yet... I need a complete picture, try checking out places mentioned in the documents.
Damn, how am I supposed to work in these conditions, with no raw materials?... Oh, hello. What do you need?
Hey there! What do you need? My stocks are low, but I'll try fixing everything you give to the best of my ability.

Oh, hello. Listen, I've been thinking... You have all of these radio stuffs just laying around in the cement plant, with no one bothering to come and pick them up... Hell, you can just simply get in through the roof.
Hayushki! Does something need fixing or just some fine tuning? Since you helped me, I'll give you a discount.
Salutations, master! How can I help? Bargain prices, just for you.
Can you unlock a memory module from a Predator UAV?
I think so, yes... I'll need about three hours to cracks this baby open. I love to fiddle with stuff like this, so I'll take just a small fee - only 1000.
Time's of the essence. You've got yourself a deal!
Excellent! I'll get to work immediately, just don't rush me. When I'm finished, I'll tell you.
Too rich for my blood.
Well, do come back when you have enough cash. You won't find a cheaper technician.
I'll think about it.
As I said, three hours of work. Now, 1000 please, as we agreed.
Well, did you unlock the memory module?
No, I'm still working on it... Don't worry, when it's ready, I'll call you.

What do you mean, didn't you get your module back? I guess Senka must've missed you, I sent him to deliver the module to you. No matter, I'll tell you what I found inside. Apart from topographic data on terrain elevation and vegetation, there were coordinates for three radio beacons. I'll download them into your PDA...
Would you like to track chimeras down?

A wounded one appeared at the Creek. She's been tracked down by Gaunt's team, but they need an experienced hunter to help them finish the job. If you could help them, I wouldn't remain indebted to you for long. I lost track of the second one, which killed Fox, it disappeared entirely... Damn, Fox... Lost the edge...
Well, I understand you killed the wounded one... I lost track of the second one, which killed Fox, it disappeared entirely... Damn, Fox... Lost the edge...
Who are you?

You can call me Tutsan. Until recently, I was a hunter, who brought down mutants that posed a real threat to stalkers. Now, I take orders for exterminations and pass them to younger hunters. I also train them in hunting tactics.
Tell me about mutant hunting.
Every mutant needs a different tactic... One for burers, another for poltergeists, yet another for pseudogiants or controllers... Then there's the chimera, for which you'll need some real skill.
Tell me about the burers.

Burers attack using gravity, either to push you away, if you come near them, or to bombard you with debris from afar... Now, the best tactic is to stay at a distance and keep moving, unless you like getting your skull cracked by flying objects. Just remember, do not underestimate his power, as he can pull your weapon from your hands with his tricks... Or weaken you temporarily, which might allow him to wound you severely.
Tell me about the poltergeist.

There are two types of poltergeists. The first one uses gravity to attack the enemy by pelting him with debris, while the second one will try to fry you, using his pyrokinesis. A typical hunter will try to circle the mutant to avoid his attacks, unaware of a crucial fact: poltergeists have no vision or hearing, at least not in the usual sense, they feel by detecting the motion of objects in a gravitational field. Therefore, an experienced hunter will stay motionless and just fire at the mutant in short bursts, staying still at all times.
Tell me about the controller.

He uses your own mind against you. If you're going up against one, use cover - if he can't see you, he can't control you. Now, remember that a controller is also terribly slow. If you value your health, then try using grenades against him.
Tell me about chimeras.

They are very dangerous nocturnal predators. They'll creep up on you, using the darkness as cover, and attack you from the rear. If you know that a chimera is around, don't let your guard down and cover your friends...
Tell me about the pseudogiant.

The hardest part in hunting pseudogiants is actually killing them. Any mutant of this type can take a tremendous amount of punishment and still keep coming. I can only advise you to keep your distance, remembering to dodge whatever they try to throw at you - they can rip off pretty much anything that isn't bolted down and use it as a projectile. Take the high ground and blast away, but make sure that the mutant won't pull it down.
Okay.
Why did you retire?

I lost my edge and allowed Fox to die. He was my partner and friend, we hunted those abominations together... At the Creek, we ran into two chimeras, in a place where none were seen for eighteen months straight. Before I even managed to draw my shotgun, Fox was already on the ground. When I wounded the second beast, they both broke off and disappeared into the darkness.
Who could steal things from a personal locker?
Hmm ... I do not know, I do not know... You see, this does not happen among hunters, unless someone's been eaten by a bloodsucker, then we field strip him...

Extreme situations need extreme solutions. As far as I know the bloodsuckers, at least a pair of them was out hunting while you gassed them. But now, when they have nowhere to return with their prey, they shouldn't be a danger to stalkers any longer.
Got any work for me?

Yes, I do. A group of stalkers went into the train tunnel, north of the Jupiter plant, straight into a mutant lair. No one could tell what kind of mutants they were, but two stalkers lost their lives in there. When news of this reached Yanov, the stalkers were unsettled and instantaneously pooled their funds, to create a reward for destroying that mutant den - 5000. It's a dangerous assignment, so watch yourself. Are you interested?
I'll take the job.
I guess you must be desperate... Good luck, you'll need it.
Not right now.
I can understand your choice... But that's hardly the bravest option.
Same as last time. Track down and exterminate any mutants in the train tunnel, north of the Jupiter factory. Payment - 5000. Will you take it?
Those mutants in the tunnels are really bothering my fellow stalkers...
Dwarf mutants lived in the tunnels. I evicted them.
Burers probably, I can see why people in Yanov were so alarmed... If I understand you correctly, they are no longer a threat, so the reward is rightfully yours.

Burers probably... They killed two stalkers recently. No wonder Yanov stalkers pooled for a reward for killing them. If I understand you correctly, they are no longer a threat, so the reward is rightfully yours.
I'm ready to go after the chimera.

Excellent. The hunter who found the bastard saw her in the evening, heading towards the ventilation complex. Chimera is a territorial, nocturnal predator, so it's likely those are her hunting grounds... I assume you can find her there at night, but be warned, she's most active in that period of time... Be careful and good hunting.
The chimera is dead.

Thanks... Thank you. May Fox rest peacefully from now on, avenged by you. Here's your money, you earned it... And one more thing, take my personal shotgun. You brought me something far more useful than this weapon - peace of mind...
I am Tutsan. You don't have to introduce yourself.
What's up?

Thank you for coming. I need a reliable and experienced hunter. You are the best of the best at Yanov, so here's the deal - after so many close calls, I can't let the chimera escape this time. I'll pay you 10000 out of my own pocket. Those are all of my savings. I need you to make sure that it goes down and stays that way... I want to make her pay for Fox.
Please, the chimera is still at large. If you don't want to do it to save Yanov from the mutant killer, then do it for the money - 10000 is not a small amount.
Did you kill the chimera? We can't wait too long or it might change it's hunting territory.
I am glad to see you! What's the news?
Do you have a job for me?

Of course. We saw a pack of marsh bloodsuckers in the swamp north of the cement plant. While they usually stay in the swamp, stalkers want to make sure that they'll stay there forever. They pay 3000 for killing the entire pack. Interested?
I'll do it.
Excellent. Load the cannons, mate.
Not right now.
I see. You can change your mind, as long as no other hunter takes the job.
Same as last time. A pack of bloodsuckers in the Smoothie swamp, near the cement plant. Payment - 3000. Interested?
There's been no developments in the marsh bloodsuckers' case...
I destroyed a pack of marsh bloodsuckers.
The stalkers can relax now. Here's your reward, as agreed.
Yes, stalkers in the are will like this news. See, they've even created a special reward for anyone who would manage to kill off those beasts... Here, the 3000 are yours now.
Together with Gaunt, we killed the chimera at the Creek.
Thank you for reducing the population of those creatures. There's still one remaining, we have to track it down and make a trophy out of it...
Thank you for killing both of these creatures. Now, stalker life should become a little safer...
Tell me about the Controller.

I learned how to bring down controllers... See, I went to this place to pick up some stuff and there was a controller there. I picked up a metal grating from the floor and, hiding behind it, creeped up on it from behind. I could feel my head pounding, as if it was going to split in half. As he tried to take me under control, I smashed its face in.
Tell me about the artifacts in the quarry.
He! I can tell you one thing - you're out of luck! After Flint goes through the anomalies, stalkers can just pack up and go home!
Yeah, the stalkers are out of luck - you left your friend to die in that anomaly!
What?!
You can't prove it, those are just empty accusations... Your word doesn't mean anything, not against the word of a Freedom fighter.
We'll see.
No, nothing.
Thank you, for now.
Tell me the story about the bloodsuckers at the Creek.

So, there was this problem - bloodsuckers were the bane of stalkers at the Creek. The boys tried to find and destroy their source, but they couldn't do it. So, one day, I decided to help them, grabbed a shotgun and went straight into their lair! The party lasted three days and ever since, the bloodsuckers stay away from the Creek.
I don't think you even know where this lair was.
Go to hell.
Oh, fuck off. Go annoy other stalkers!
Fuck you, your word doesn't mean anything against the word of a Freedom fighter.
We'll see!
Thank you, for now.
Tell me a story about the short cut to the Jupiter factory.

The Creek guide did not have a safe route plotted, so I decided to help him out. I went out there, went on an azimuth from southern Creek, made a few turns, found a handful of short cuts, mapped out the anomalies and then plotted a new, safer route. I gave it to the Guide to try out. He's been using it ever since.
Maybe we should as Pilot who gave him the map?
Go to hell.
Oh, fuck off. Go annoy other stalkers!
You can't prove me wrong. Your word doesn't mean anything against the word of a Freedom fighter.
We'll see!
Thank you, for now.
Tell me about your trip to the Oasis.

I was the first to actually visit the Oasis. There were no monsters there and no anomalies - just silence and tranquillity. Oh, and heaps of artifacts, but I didn't want to disturb the peace of the Oasis, so I didn't take any.
You're a liar. I saw the Oasis, It's nothing like what you describe.
Go to hell.
Oh, fuck off. Go annoy other stalkers!
You're the liar... Your word doesn't mean anything against the word of a Freedom fighter.
We'll see!
Thank you, for now.
Tell me how you worked for the scientists.

I came to their bunker recently. They said "We need your skill and experience, Flint!" Turned out they needed me to install their anomaly monitoring equipment. No problem - I jumped straight into the anomalies, deployed their thingamajigs... It was harder to coax my reward out of them.

Stop claiming other people's work as yours. That was my job!
not assign other people's merits. That I'm doing.
Go to hell.
Oh, fuck off. Go annoy other stalkers!
Lies... You can't prove it. Your word doesn't mean anything against the word of a Freedom fighter.
We'll see!
Thank you, for now.
Greetings. Do you want to hear my stories too?
Is something on your mind?
Well, what do you want from me?
Dude.. Fuck, man... I'm dying...
Here, take a first aid kit.

No... Thanks friend... This isn't going to help... Listen... I came here... With a Freedomer... We found an artifact... But I fell into the Fruit Punch on our way back... If he had helped me, I'd still have a chance... But... He took the artifact and run... He said he was going to get help... But he lied... Find him.... Find him... And let everyone know... He's a scoundrel...
I'll find him.
I won't be able to prove anything.
Grab my arm, maybe I can get you to the medic in time...
Happens to everyone. See ya.
I have something for you.
Yes, have a Meat Chunk.
Thank you. The scientists pay well, but the pass is more important to me.
Thanks a lot! Now, I'll finally be able to get up and go to Pripyat - I only need to find a way to get there.
Yes, here's a Kolobok.
Thank you. The scientists pay well, but the pass is more important to me.
Thanks a lot! Now, I'll finally be able to get up and go to Pripyat - I only need to find a way to get there.
Yes, here, I have a Meat Chunk and a Kolobok.
Thanks a lot! Now, I'll finally be able to get up and go to Pripyat - I only need to find a way to get there.
Nope, nothing.
Why are you bored?
You talked about a contract...

I've signed on for work with the scientists... I didn't think it would take me long to finish their assignments, but I failed to consider that the contract would be completed only after I've done all of their tasks. However, they did promise me an official Zone pass in return.

I've completed the contract almost completely, except for two little details. I was tasked to find all types of artifacts created in chemical anomalies, but I didn't know that finding a Meat Chunk or a Kolobok would be this hard in this area. If it wasn't, I'd be long gone, heading for Pripyat, but as it is, I'm stuck here!
Perhaps I can help you with the artifacts.
That's sad....
Yeah... Get me a Meat Chunk and a Kolobok and I'll be on my way to Pripyat within minutes...
What's so interesting about Pripyat?

No one knows the way, you can't just walk in a straight way and hope to arrive there. Rumours circulate about Klondike artifacts being there... Generally, it's an interesting place to visit, with so many legends about it in circulation...
I'm putting together a squad for a hike in Pripyat, do you want to come with us?
I'd love to explore Pripyat... But, forgive me, I'm used to plotting new paths alone...
Ha, I'll be heading for Pripyat soon... But, forgive me, I'm used to plotting new paths alone...
Welcome to our little den.
Man, exploring Pripyat... Now that's going to be awesome.
Now, I just need to prepare myself for my trip to Pripyat...
Great! Now that's what I call really living!
It's good to feel safe. But I'm bored.
Perhaps I can help you with the artifacts.
Do you know the way to Pripyat?

I do not, but if there are really that many artifacts there, I'm ready to run there even now. I'm an old veteran, one of the first to find a way to Jupiter. But I always travel my paths alone, without having to watch out for others.
Can you get me to the Jupiter?
Of course. Ready to go?
Yes.
Not yet.
Do you honestly want me to go out during a blowout?
Can you get me to Pripyat?
I can try, for 5000. I love the challenge!
It's a deal.
Uh, not right now.
Your business.
It seems I don't have enough money.
I can try, for 5000. Let's just wait out the blowout.
Can you take me to the Creek?
Nah, it's a boring job for me. Ask Pilot, he's an old slogger who likes this sort of stuff.
Well, I'll take you to Yanov and then arrange with the Pilot to take you to the Creek for 3000. What do you think?
I agree.
No.
As you wish.
I do not have enough money.
Well, I'll take you to Yanov and then arrange with the Pilot to take you to the Creek for 1000. What do you think?
Nah, it's a boring job for me. Ask Pilot, he's an old slogger who likes this sort of stuff. He can take you there after the blowout.
Well, I'll take you to Yanov and then arrange with the Pilot to take you to the Creek for 3000... Just, you know - let the emission end.
Well, I'll take you to Yanov and then arrange with the Pilot to take you to the Creek for 1000... Just, you know - let the emission end.
You say you came through the tunnels? I also came from the Jupiter, but through a route on the surface. If you need it, I can take you back for free... I'm kind of an official guide lately.

Hey there, we haven't seen each other lately! You say you came through the tunnels? I also came from the Jupiter, but through a route on the surface. If you need it, I can take you back for free... I'm kind of an official guide lately.

You say you came through the tunnels? Imagine, I managed to finish the contract and get a pass... I came here immediately, after finding a surface road that led to Pripyat. If you need it, I can take you back to Jupiter for free... I'm kind of an official guide lately.

Hey there, we haven't seen each other lately! You say you came through the tunnels? I also came from the Jupiter, but through a route on the surface. If you need it, I can take you back for free... I'm kind of an official guide lately. Oh, by the way, thanks for helping me close the deal with the scientists. I had a little time to roam around a bit, thanks to you, so, here, take this. I know you'll put it to good use.
Poplar, why won't you protect the bunker of the scientists?
We're collecting samples and doing measurements for the scientists, straight junior researchers and the like. We could protect them too, but I am... reluctant to lose my life to a mercenary's bullet.
What, you got lost? Piss off, or I'll get angry.
Boy, are you looking for problems? Git!
Dude, take a hike! Don't piss us off.
What's next?
We will be going to Yanov soon. If you want to, you can come with us.
Well, I am with you.
No, I'll stay here.
It's good that you brought them to us. They wouldn't last much longer out here.
Thanks for picking Duty.
What's going to do next?
We will be going to Yanov soon. If you want to, you can come with us.
Well, I am with you.
No, I'll stay around here.
Dude, you did the right thing. You've helped the peeps and got us some reinforcements. Respect, man.
Thanks for getting Freedom to do the job.
Do you know who could steal stuff from my personal locker?
I don't know the people around here... You should ask the Chiropractor, he does.
Let's go to Zulus.
Good. He won't start shooting when he sees my old armour, right? I need to pick it up on the way and return the one I'm wearing.
Let's go.
Wait, I won't go out during an emission... Come back in a while.
What's happened to you?

Understand, we do not remember how we ended up in this place. We remember we were a part of the Monolith group, eager to break through to the centre of the Zone.
