There was supposed to be a monolith, a meteorite there, which came to us from another planet, bringing seeds of new life with it... I remember how we all managed to reach the Chernobyl NPP... And then, it goes blurry, I can only recall bits and pieces. A bright light... Cold space... A crystal clear voice... Everything was so simple, so... right. And now, I can't remember his orders. A few years of life just disappeared. We have no idea what to do now, we just need shelter from the blowouts and the mutants, OK? Can you suggest a place for us to hide?
There is a stalker camp nearby, I can mark it on your map.

I'm not so sure... Since we come from the NPP, we might not be welcome... It seems to me that we were killing stalkers back then, so I think they'll start shooting first and won't ask any questions... Although this might just be my assumption. Listen, could you go to the camp and find out if they'd be willing to accept us, since we're no longer murderers? Please, we are in need of your help.
Alright, I'll go to the camp and talk to the locals.
I can't help.
What kind of help do you need?
We need shelter from the emissions... and the mutants. Can you find us a place where we could hide?
Alright, I'll ask around Yanov.
I can't help you.
You need a suit with a closed-circuit system of breathing for our excursion to Pripyat.
It won't be a problem, I still have my Monolith suit, which has such a system. I don't think I should appear at Yanov with this armour on, though.
I'm putting together a squad for an excursion to Pripyat, want to come with me?
I'd go, I want to know what happened with us there... But not right now. I can't leave my boys here and I doubt they'd be willing to go back to Pripyat, too many bad memories in that place.
Yes, I'll go with you. The question "What happened to us?" haunts me constantly. Hopefully, I'll find the answer in Pripyat. I'll just tell Loki, I don't think he'll object.
Yes, I'll go with you. The question "What happened to us?" haunts me constantly. Hopefully, I'll find the answer in Pripyat. I'll just tell the Colonel, I don't think he'll object.
Are you ready to go?
Ready.
Hello stalker. Could you help us?
Hello. Do you know if we can come to Yanov?
Not yet.
Act quickly, anything might happen out here.
Hello. Thank you for helping us.
Hello.
How are you doing?
Pretty good, everything's in order with my boys. It's just... I keep asking myself - what happened to us?
What are the mercenaries doing here?

You'd better talk to Herman about this, he's in charge of this entire scientific operation. As far as I know, Herman hired them to protect our laboratory, but I don't know the details. However, I must admit, that when it comes to combat, they have proven their professional competence repeatedly.
What are you doing here?
A rhetorical question, don't you think? We are researching. Are you interested in any particular subject?
What is the purpose of your research?

We do not have a clear goal. You can call our work "scientific reconnaissance". We look for patterns in the various phenomena existing here, then create theories which we prove or disprove. Some of our theories aren't designed for any practical use, at least not in the short term.
What do you know about the Zone?

I can only speculate... I think that the Zone emerged due to a completely new type of force. The biosphere cannot change this fast under any of the known forces, electromagnetism, gamma radiation, physical... I admit, some of the mutations can be attributed to excessive exposure to nuclear radiation... But look, to have an ordinary pig mutate into a flesh, we'd need hundreds, if not thousands of years... But here, in the Zone, the process only took twenty four months to complete, as if someone could actually manipulate genetic information in any living creature. The remote possibility of this being true makes me shiver.
How long have you been in the Zone?

Not particularly long. It takes an enormous amount of effort to organize any kind of expedition here, thanks to our bureaucracy. If it wasn't for Herman, we'd still be sitting somewhere on the edges of the Zone, waiting for something to happen, while stalkers would scavenge the most valuable specimens.
I've no more questions.
Why would Herman hire me to protect the group during the measurements?

I advised him to do so. He didn't think it was necessary, but I managed to persuade him. My research indicates that our high energy equipment agitates nearby mutated creatures when placed in anomalies, increasing their aggression. Basically, any mutants in the vicinity will want to kill you.
I have news.
Yes? I'm listening.
You were right. While they were taking measurements, mutants just kept on coming, but as soon as they switched the devices off, everything calmed down.

What? Huh... If my hypothesis is confirmed, then there's the probability that, as a direct result of the mutations, certain individual creatures posses an innate ability to read information from the noosphere and perceive a signal passed to the outside... created artificially and then... unnaturally similar mutations... and these characteristic changes in cell structure... Hmmm... aren't accidental...
Earth to Ozersk, Earth to Ozersk, can you speak in plain language?
Oh, no, this is just me thinking aloud... Oh, where are my manners! Here, my deepest thanks for the study!
What do I need to do for you, to get you to talk to Herman about the suit?

Recently an anomaly appeared on the edge of the quarry, one we haven't analysed yet, affecting the grove it emerged in. I'd like to receive a sample of the vegetation in this grove, since most stalkers refuse to go near it. If I had a sample from one of the plants there, it'd be a good reason to ask Herman to give you one of our spare suits as a reward.
I'll get you the plant sample.
Well, I sent you the coordinates of the anomaly to your PDA.
Another time.
Come back, if you change your mind.
I brought you a plant sample, here. Now, how about a suit?

Excellent. Heh, Sokolov already mentioned that he'll need such a suit! Well, it's nothing, I'll show this sample to Herman, he should agree to give out the suit. Go tell Sokolov to come over and get it.
I can look for new guards to protect your bunker.
That would be very kind of you. Talk to Herman, solving these problems is his responsibility.
I would like to test my resistance to psi emissions.

So, Herman sent you to me? Well, try to remain as still as possible. In order to analyse your resistance to psionic radiation, I'll need a whole range of tests and years of careful analysis. And I have an almost complete field medical set and some dirty tubes to do it.
So, I take it that it's impossible?

Oh, don't worry. It won't be a full analysis, as for our purposes, it's enough to just gauge how your neural tissue reacts to psionic fields. This is a straightforward exam, so... Apparently, everything's in order with your head. That is, you can withstand fairly intense levels of psionic radiation and remain sane.
What was your hypothesis about increased mutant aggression?

I have two. One assumes that the primary cause of aggression is the invasion of humans on the creature's territory, which is normal behaviour, characteristic of most vertebrate species, including humans. Another is that the mutants can somehow detect active anomaly monitoring devices. But this is where the problem's at.
A problem? How can I help?

See, to confirm either of those theories, you need to activate the scanner in an area where no mutant activity has been reported to date. Additionally, to minimize human presence in the area, this experiment has to be conducted alone.
I brought the scanner.
And what are the results?
I think your hypothesis is confirmed. When I turned the scanner on, Snorks kept attacking me for the five minutes.
I thought so... Why does the least desirable theory have to be true? In any case, it's good that you confirmed it, now we know that we have to send full size squads to conduct the measurements.
I'm ready to evaluate your hypothesis.

I'm glad that there are still people ready to sacrifice themselves on the altar of science! The best location for the experiments is the clearing at the south edge of the quarry, where there are gravitational anomalies that the mutants avoid. There's an integrated mutant detector in the device I'll give you, which will allow me to assess the influence of the radiation on mutant aggressiveness. Are you ready to go?
Yes, I am ready.
No, I'm not ready.
Is it possible to get one of your protective suits?
Well, no. We have limited supplies... Although, knowing Herman, he probably ordered more than we will ever need. I think that, under certain conditions, he can be persuaded to give you one.
Do you offer artifact contracts?
Sorry, no. We do not like to order artifacts and get several in return. We already have a contract with an experienced artifact hunter, who gets us everything we need.
I can find you new guards.
It would be nice. The Zone's always dangerous... Talk about it to Herman, he's the senior guy around here.
I am supposed to receive anomaly scanners from you.
Here, Herman told me to give you three of them.
Here, Herman told me to give two more pieces.
Can I get one of your protective suits?
You should ask Herman about it, but I can tell you that getting anything out of him is hard. You are better off talking to Ozersky. He might be softer, but he is the only one who can persuade Herman.
What's up?
Listen, the mercenaries who protected us disappeared somewhere...
So, how's life, youngster?
Listen ... Someone shot the mercenaries who were protecting us. I didn't like them much, but still...
Wow, a CHN-3a! Nice armour... Brings back memories...
Can you unlock a memory module from a Predator UAV?
Let me take a look... No problem, I've worked with those already. Come back in an hour. Oh yeah, I'll take... hmm... 2000 for the job. Deal?
Deal.
Alright, I'll contact you when I unlock this baby.
I don't have enough money.
Hmmm. Come see me when you have enough, I don't think you'll find anyone willing to work with this for less.
I'll think about it.
As I said, I'll crack it in an hour, for 2000.
Well, did you unlock the memory module?
The hour is not over yet. Like I said, I'll call you.
Yes, I did. I've got all the information right here.
I found a strange artifact, are you interested?
I most certainly am. Where did you find it?
At the Creek, it was in a derelict dredging barge.
Here it is.
No, I'll look for another buyer.
What are the mercenaries doing here?

We have a contract for protection of the mobile laboratory with them. I'll answer you straight away, I was forced by circumstances to cooperate with them. Because of some secret military operation, we weren't provided with any kind of protection for our research camp. Since some sort of an artifact gold rush started for stalkers, I had to agree to cooperate with the mercenaries in order to somehow secure the laboratory.
What are you doing here?
Performing research into various kinds of phenomena.
What is the purpose of your research?

We conduct fundamental research, that is, we do not test suits or invent drugs, but try to come up with rational, scientific explanations for what we see in the Zone. If we can understand just ten percent of what occurs here on a daily basis, we will experience an unprecedented leap of technology on Earth.
What do you know about the Zone?

To be honest, very little. We are only beginning to understand some of the phenomena and we are, unfortunately, still far from being able to give any kind of comprehensive description of the Zone. Everything is further complicated by the fact that it changes over time. I'm not talking about new anomalies emerging, no, I'm talking about deeper, substantial changes that may be imperceptible to humans. Weakening of the magnetic field, for instance. I find it very sad that we are not able to comprehend this and have to sit and wait.
How long have you been in the Zone?

Not long at all. While I visited Professor Sakharov's laboratory before, I wasn't able to form an expedition until now. No matter how many times I told the Ministry of Education that we needed at least two fully equipped mobile laboratories in the Zone, they just nodded their heads. Their ignorance almost cost us the greatest opportunity in the history of the Zone.
I see.
Is there any new information from the scanners I placed in the anomalies?
Which anomaly are you interested in?
Parking lot anomaly.
Yes! Instruments show that this anomaly has artifacts!
Unfortunately, no signs of artifacts in the anomaly.
Concrete Bathtub anomaly.
Asphalt anomaly.
Smoothie anomaly.
Ashes anomaly.
That's all for now.
Listen carefully.

In light of recent developments, it became clear that the quality of our research unit leaves much to be desired, since you were the only one to be able to resist the controller, which is amazing in itself!
What's your point?
It'd be unreasonable to neglect this opportunity to employ such an experienced stalker like you. Our scientific team is definitely in need of your services. We need measurements, device placement...
Go on.

I'm trying to find a correlation between emissions and the appearance of artifacts in the anomalies. I have a theory on how to predict how many artifacts of any given type will appear in an anomaly after an emission. In order to complete my calculations, I need statistics and to get statistics, I need several scanners to be placed inside anomalies of different types.
I'm not interested.
A pity. You could serve the noble cause of science.
Well, I'll help you in this matter.
Wonderful! Go to Novikov and take the scanners, then install them in anomalies I marked on your PDA. When you're done, return immediately, I'll need you to do one more thing.
I'll think about it and do it later.
I installed your scanners in the anomalies.
Remarkable, I am already receiving results. I am looking forward to the moment when I'll be able to complete my calculations...
Tell me more.

When I approached it and pulled my detector out, I could feel that the space around me was getting distorted. After a few moments, several dead bodies fell out from the centre of the distortion. After that, everything stopped.

That is simply amazing! Of course, I have too little data and I can't say anything you say for granted, but... I'll add your description to our index. Do you think "Spatial Bubble" will be a good name for this anomaly?
How's your new protection?
They are really good at what they do. With them behind our back, we can feel safe. Thank you for your trouble, here's your reward.
Take a look at these documents.
Let me see... I won't ask where did you get them, but they are just incredible! Give me a moment, I'll take a copy ... There. Also, incidentally, take this modest fee.
What happened to your protection?
I do not know. They just disappeared somewhere!
I could find new guards for you.
That would be just great! Our employees receive full scientific support and latest technology for their participation. Of course, you'll also be compensated for your efforts.
Agreed.
I shall await the arrival of our new guards eagerly.
I changed my mind.
I'm sorry.
Happens.
What do you need?
Our guards were shot! Just outside the walls of our bunker!
I found these documents at the Jupiter factory. Can you take a look?
Interesting information... However, they contain little in the way of useful data, sadly. I still thank you for your trouble, if you find anything else, be sure to bring it to us too.
When I was searching for the documents, I was attacked by mercenaries. Here's the PDA of their commander.
That's the same person that was in charge of protecting us, but I thought that was their only current assignment... Looks like I'll have to contact my superiors... Thank you very much, young man.
Unfortunately, there is no interesting information therein.

Hmm, look: you want to learn about the last developments that took place in the Jupiter building, while I need their technical documentation urgently. I will suggest that you look in the administration building of the factory.
Well, I'll look around.
No, I can't help.
I brought you some documents from the Jupiter factory.
Interesting information... However, they contain little in the way of useful data, sadly. I still thank you for your trouble, if you find anything else, be sure to bring it to us to.
When I was searching for the documents, I was attacked by mercenaries. Here's the PDA of their commander.
That's the same person that was in charge of protecting us, but I thought that was their only current assignment... Looks like I'll have to contact my superiors... Thank you very much, young man.
I'll look into this anomaly.
I did not do it before.
About my participation in your research...
I would be pleased, if you agree to once again serve science. Are you interested?
I would like to help in taking the measurements.
Do you agree to help us complete external scan?
Yes, I'll help.
No, I need some more time to think it over.
You talked about placing devices.

I'm trying to find a correlation between emissions and the appearance of artifacts in the anomalies. I have a theory on how to predict how many artifacts of any given type will appear in an anomaly after an emission. In order to complete my calculations, I need statistics and to get statistics, I need several scanners to be placed inside anomalies of different types.
Well, I'll help you in this matter.
Wonderful! You need to take in Novikov scanners, and install them in the abnormalities noted on your PDA.
I think about it and go up later.

scanners in anomalies already transmit information. We can only wait for the results. If you want you can add a couple of scanners. We have extra data does not interfere, and your reward will be information about the appearance of artifacts in the anomaly.
I agree.
Wonderful! Go to Novikov and take the scanners, then install them in anomalies I marked on your PDA. When you're done, return immediately, I'll need you to do one more thing.
I think about it and do it later.
Unfortunately, my dear friend, we have a rule: each person can only participate in a single ongoing study. It'd be confusing otherwise.
Did you receive the results of measurements from the group I protected?
I would like to add that the measurements clearly attracted the attention of mutants and zombies. I had to work hard to defend everyone.

Hmm, how interesting... The measurements actually attracted them? Well, Ozersk's hypothesis about the mutants being able to perceive different types of fields via telepathy seems to be true, thanks to you, my friend. Maybe you should go tell him about it. Here's your payment for the job, you deserve it.

Hmm, how interesting... The measurements actually attracted them? Well, Ozersk's hypothesis about the mutants being able to perceive different types of fields via telepathy seems to be true, thanks to you, my friend. Maybe you should go tell him about it... However, I am saddened by the deaths of our stalkers. A part of our meagre supplies goes to compensate their family members. The rest, of course, is your payment.
Can I get one of your protective suits?
Out of the question, my friend! The number of suits is strictly limited, I can't afford to just give them away freely.
What do you have for me?
Did you, by any chance, see our guards around?
Speak.
Did you see that, someone gunned down our guard, right outside of our bunker!
Do you need help?
See, we are collecting new types samples right now. They are inert alone, but experiments with them gave incredible results!
Go on.
Any details?

Our stalkers located a peculiar psi-field and are convinced that a mutant den lies within. Ha! What kind of a mutant, except for a controller, would be able to survive in an alternating psionic field? Now, our stalkers can cope with mutants, but we need you, because their exposure to anomalies has led to a decrease in their resistance.
So, basically, you want me to penetrate this alternating psi-field and collect a sample, which might not even be here, but if it is, you have no idea how it would look like?

See, this assignment is very important to science in general, our group in particular. If you have any doubts, go to Ozersk, he can conduct a test which will show you your current resistance to psionic fields. You can also ask our stalkers about it, they'll explain everything. So, are you willing to help science?
Yes, I am.
Your stalkers are dead.
Look, my friend... Since you did not come to the tunnel, it'll be extremely difficult to persuade them to work with you again.
It was an accident.

I think I believe you. But, consider this - our collection team is composed of uniquely talented people, ones you should not fail. I'll talk to them again, see if I can convince them to do this. Don't let me down either, I'm waiting for a sample.

Forgive me for saying this, but you are woefully under equipped to tackle an alternating psi-field. Without proper protection, you'll experience nothing except for a sudden, painful death. I can't take this responsibility...
I got the sample.
Yes? Really? Do not make me wait, where is it?
I got your sample. Turns out, a controller lived in the tunnel, who trued to mind control your group. He almost managed to do it, but I killed him.

Unbelievable! You killed the controller and saved our stalkers from his psi-attack! If I heard it from anyone else, I would not believe it. Well, this must've been an useful experience and you got us an excellent sample. You have made a tremendous contribution to science. Thank you very much, on behalf of myself, our group and all scientists of the world.
Unfortunately, the group was attacked by a controller. I had to defend myself, so... The controller and your stalkers are all dead.

A controller? What a horror... But who could know? I am genuinely sorry for them ... We lost loyal servants of science. They might not have had degrees, but their contributions are more significant than those of any professor. My thanks to you. Please accept this modest reward ...
Unfortunately, the group was attacked by a controller. I just ran.
What are the mercenaries doing here?

They interfere with my work. But, this just my personal opinion,, based on their behaviour. At first, they had simple requests, to put something together correctly... But since yesterday, they became arrogant, asking uncomfortable questions about our equipment. That information certainly doesn't help them do their job better.
What modifications can you do?

As you can see, this is a scientific complex... You won't see Kevlar or gun parts around here, but I can patch a vest or modify a gun with some of my personal inventions. See, I have a bit of surplus gear in my stock...

Thanks to your data from the psi-field, Ozersky was able to invent something that will protect prom this kind of radiation. I managed to make his invention practical and I can install it in any of your suits.

Well, besides the usual range of improvements, I can offer filtration and psi-defence. Your help in getting data necessary for this kind of upgrade was a blessing. I haven't seen Ozersky and Herman this happy ever since I got here.

> Well, besides the usual range of improvements, I can offer insulation and psi-defence. Your help in getting data necessary for this kind of upgrade was a blessing. I haven't seen Ozersky and Herman this happy ever since I got here.

I have all the data needed for installing insulation, filtration, and psi-defence. A suit will all three of these upgrades will allow you to survive any anomaly... and even survive. By the way, thanks for helping Herman with his studies. Without those results, my offer would still be limited.
Tell me about your bunker.
Hmm. What are you interested in?
What does this lab actually do?

I think even Herman and Ozersky couldn't answer this question. Of course, they carry out various studies and all, but... there's little in the way of beneficial results of their research. Thankfully, Ozersky's a nice guy to chat with. His theories helped me develop a couple of fairly good protective modifications.
What do you know about the Zone?

Science-wise - nothing. However, in terms of experience, I have more than enough. In the Zone, only things that increase your chances of survival matter. The Zone doesn't care if you're a stalker, who collects artifacts to feed his family, or a gangster. Only the most adapted will survive here.
How long have you been in the Zone?

It's not my first day, that's for sure. At first, I came over for the artifacts, but I soon realized that my health was not enough to survive in the anomalies. Fortunately, if you have the proper skills, you can find a place for yourself easily. I spent almost a year with a group of former scientists. They were good guys, I think it's a shame they were all killed in a blind race to some obscure goal. I drifted across the Zone for some time, before being employed by the scientists. I do not regret that decision.
No more questions.
I'm going to enter an alternating psi-field. Any advice?

Need advice? You are certainly unfamiliar with the theory of information and energy fields... Just remember, short-term effects of the psi-field are not dangerous... in the long run. Don't relax too much, though, those who underestimate the psi-field end up completely zombified.
Can you break open a steel container?
I have all the necessary equipment except for... Well, the safety rules do not allow me to do this.
Can you decrypt a black box?
Yes, I can, but I won't. I once had to deal with such a thing, didn't like it. It's a tedious, time consuming job. Scientists' requests are enough to keep me busy.
What's so special about the CHN-3a?

Apart from the fact that I built it? It's one of the best suits in the Zone. You can feel it yourself - lightweight, flexible, based on a strong military flak jacket. I've added anomaly protection to each suit myself. It's a shame I had to built them without full access to materials... You see, we were camped out in the middle of a swamp... I had to literally put them together with duct tape and wire, like in science fiction novels. Fortunately, now I have a full shop with proper supplies.
You work for Owl?
No. He recently helped me to get something... Consider this job a quid pro quo.
Owl asked me to bring you the detectors. Here they are.
Good. I'll work on them, and return them to Owl through a courier... Then you can conduct your business with him.
Oh, it was you, who I saw at the Creek, selling arms to the bandits.
Yes, but be quiet.. Are you completely insane to talk about it that loud? Now, look, I haven't seen anything, you haven't either. You dig?
Yeah, I dig.
And what if I tell your commander about your little side venture?
And what will you tell him? You have nothing on me. You've helped me get rid of the witnesses and without evidence you'll just embarrass yourself.
I found a mercenary PDA with a contract for my life. A contract placed by you.
Of for fuck's sake... Now, consider this: if you give me this PDA, I'll give you a weapon available only to Duty's most elite members. OK?
Well, I'll take the rifle.
I'll keep this. I don't need gifts from a two faced dealer.
I have another PDA with your order to kill me.

Oh fuck... Bloody mercenaries, they can't even finish one order... Okay, listen you fucking blackmailer... Let's strike a deal. I will cancel the contract, get the mercenaries off your back, while you leave me alone. As compensation, I will show you Duty's secret weapon store. You can loot it at your leisure.
Well, let's go.
Alright, we'll meet there. The stash is located near the quarry.
I'm not going. Give me everything now.
I don't have anything here. I am no fool, I hide my stuff in plain sight. Either you meet me by the cache or you're not getting anything.
I'm not going.
I do not need handouts from a two faced dealer.
I want to leave the Zone.
Are you sure? This is a one way trip.
I'm sure. Let's go.
I see... I'm staying here, then.
Now, let me take a look... Well, the liver's enlarged, obviously, but that's part of the job. As for the rest, you're as healthy as a burer.
Yes, that would be most common, if not glowing. And yet... it doesn't become one. You can go look for yourself... an eerie spectacle.
Your choice.
Former Monolithans, yes? Well, look... Are you ready to vouch for them?
Former Monolithans, yes? No thanks... I don't need a bunch of aggressive fanatics.
Ha... Good... You worry about your friend... That's why we captured him. Now, what are you going to do - give us an artifact or pay 15000?
I brought you the artifact.
Yep. Which one?
I do not have an artifact valuable enough for you.
A Flame.
A Goldfish.
A Firefly.
A Snowflake.
Hmm... No, no.
Well, I let them have their say... And you say they won't back down...
See ya.

Of course! The alternating psi-field needs to be investigated without delay! Perhaps you'll feel more confident in the relative safety of his company? We just need you to obtain a small test sample. Will you agree to help science?
I can help you pick new people for your research group.
Really? That would be very helpful... and, perhaps, I could offer you a reward for it.
Good. I'll find you some professionals.
I will think about it.
Here it is. As it turned out, a controller lived in the tunnel. I killed him.

Unbelievable! You returned to us, with the sample, after killing a controller? Forgive me, but if I didn't know you, I wouldn't believe it. This must have been an useful experience for you and you also managed to procure an invaluable specimen for us! You've made an enormous contribution to science! Thank you, on behalf of myself, my team and my colleagues.
Here's the sample. As it turned out, a controller lived in the tunnel. I barely made it out alive.

A controller, you say? That's horrible, but how were we supposed to know? Well, the most important matter is that you came back with a sample and made a contribution to science. Thank you... and please, accept this modest reward.
How's your new research group?
Not bad. Rather adequate, these young people... Here you go. This is your payment as my, let's say, head hunter.
Cheers, brother. Don't get me wrong, I like guests... but I prefer to stay here alone.
I'm here about the stalker you keep hostage. I want to buy him out.

And I want you to respect the rule of thieves... That's what I demand. We do not need any extra chaos... So, 15000 will be a high enough fine for his first offence. Or an appropriate artifact... I don't want to bankrupt you.
Here's the money, take it.
I will... Now, remember about the respect. Take the boy... And tell the stalkers that next time, the fines will be higher.
I do not have enough money.
Clearly, not even close. You were saying?
I don't have anything suitable with me, I'll be back later.
Let me take a look... Hmmm... That's some vital strategic information you have there. It may be useful, so I'll make you an offer - 500 for the document. Do we have a deal?
Let me take a look... Saint Patrick... This information will allow us to severely set Duty back... I'm ready to pay you 4000 up front for this.
Interesting. Well, I am ready to buy it from you for 2000.
Yes, the price is still the same - 2000.
Yep, yet.

But... But.... This is terrible! What could've happened to them? Hmmm... Perhaps mutants got them... I have to ask Ozersk what kind of... Oh, ahem. Nonetheless, we still need to assess the psi-field. You see, this is very important for science in general and our group in particular. I just need you to obtain a small test sample. If you still have doubts, go to Ozersk. He can run a rudimentary exam that will show you your current resistance to psionic radiation. Will you agree to help science?
I'll think about it.

Recently, our research group - recruited from local stalkers - found a psi-field of a very, very unusual nature. According to our calculations and collected data, this field has a variable intensity instead of a permanent, fixed one...
I'm sorry, but our research group is dead, and until we can find a replacement, we can't conduct any measurements or other operations.
Wait, my dear friend... Could you give me another minute of your time?
What are the anomaly scan results?
Do you have any work for me?
I have.

Unfortunately, I was unable to persuade Herman to send out an expedition to search for it... You know, rumours about this phenomenon are wildly inconsistent, but if you want my opinion, I am convinced that the Oasis exists. Call it intuition. If you can find the Oasis and bring me irrefutable proof of its existence, then science would be very grateful to you and me.
Well, I visited the Oasis already.
Ahem-m ... I. .. I'm not sure I heard you correctly. What did you say?
I came to pay Vano's debt.
Hmm, hmmm... He has a great debt to pay and the interest just keeps on piling... He owes me 7000 already.
Here, take this cash.
Okay... Tell Vano that I wrote off the debt.
Alright.
I don't have enough.
Get everything and then come back.
There was no mention of interest.
Uh, hello! Of course there was! Just take a look: without interest, would we be floating? Seven keys, that's final.
Now, take a moment to think. Think hard. I'm standing next to you, with a gun in my hand... Is interest really worth dying for?
Chill, brother... chill! I was just, uh, joking! Let's deal. Heh, can't two players reach an agreement? Just 5000 to pay.
You aren't gonna threaten me into submission and you're not gonna pop a cap in my head. I repeat - 7000, with interest.
Did you forget already? I have a gun here, right by my side.
It would be cheaper to just shoot you.
I think so.
In short... with interest - 7000.

I can do without company for a bit... I need to pull myself together. You know, I'll head home, generally. I'll find myself a job - blasted artifacts, probably! I can't leave Bear or Bags... We became strong friends, always working together... Oh, I don't know... I need some rest, put my head in order.

I can do without company for a bit: I'll go and work for the scientists... I wonder - can I go home? There's surely work to be found outside the Zone... Oh, I don't know. I need some rest and time to think this through...
So, are you ready to go rescue Mityai? If you are, then remember - you won't be in command of the guys I've hired.
I have two PDAs: one that belonged to Morgan and another that belonged to Duty's founder. Interested?
I have a PDA with evidence that Morgan is connected to the mercenaries.
No. I'm leaving and taking this thing with myself.

I knew that your conscience and desire to help science would win! Well, listen closely now. Our research group will conduct the measurements, while you'll serve as their escort, their protection and guide through almost impassable places. They are waiting for you outside... good luck!

Hello, stalker. Surprised to see your uncle here? Heh-heh... I came here with the boys, to stretch my old bones. I fix all the iron the buys are packing and, well, the boys themselves from time to time...
Look at the spark in those eyes! What do you need, youngster?
How did you get to Pripyat?

Well, Garik showed us the way. All stalkers wanted to come here for a long time, but they were discouraged by the prospect of meeting soldiers. Now, that was the moment when Garik spoke: This is our street festival, the military left Pripyat!. I thought to myself, why shouldn't an old dog practice his old tricks again? A short time later, Uncle Yar is in Pripyat already. And how!
I need medical help.
Let your uncle take a look...
Well, you will live. If something starts hurting - put some compressed honey on the place. And put some honey in your tea too.
Such am athlete? Oh, you're just toying with Uncle Yar, heh, heh...
Welcome to my little slice of heaven. What do you want me to share with you?

Now, hear this, I'm from a godly take. My friends tell me: What are you, Gnome, sincere, strong, direct really straight from fairy tales. He-he... In short, we were happy, but just the first time. Everything went downhill from there.
I was there already. All the bandits are dead.
Wow, well, you're cool! Thank you for your help! You can keep the money I gave you to cover the debt. I'm so happy yo have met a guy like you!
Wow, my dear friend, well, you're cool! Thank you for your help! You can take the money I wanted to cover the debt with. Don't be a stranger!

Our scanners picked up some unusual activity to the north. Based on the data we received, this anomalous formation is highly unstable. Unfortunately, we cannot inspect the location remotely and need someone on location... Now, regular detectors will not help to detect this anomaly - our newest development, the Svarog, is essential for this.

Our scanners continue to pick up an anomalous formation in the north. If you have anything better than regular stalker detectors - say, a Svarog - I think you would be able to inspect this anomaly in the field.

You've analysed the anomaly in the swamp - Novikov already found practical uses for your data and created a new modernization. Thank you for your work, I'm looking forward to seeing the next part of the scan results.

You've analysed the anomaly at Kopachi - Novikov already found practical uses for your data and created a new modernization. Thank you for your work, I'm looking forward to seeing the next part of the scan results.

Of course! I've got more than enough data. Frankly, its volume is so large that it will take weeks, if not months, to process it fully. However, Novikov has already managed to put this information to practical use in his upgrades. Thank you very much for your help!

Woah! Haven't seen anyone here... No, wait, stop, I saw a suspicious guy recently. I went outside to grab a breath of fresh air and when I was going back, I saw a stalker leaving Yanov. Once he saw me, he began to mumble something along the lines of "No, no, he'll find me". I paid him no heed - well, you never know how things are in an idiot's world - but now that you say it, he did look pretty suspicious.
Where did he go?

To the north-east. I heard some gunfire there... however, I don't know if that's significant, it's a common sound here. You could ask Zulus - he sits on the old clock tower constantly, maybe he saw something.
To the north-east, I think there's a small railway station there.
I see.
What's up, friend?
How are you holding up?
Well, I'm in good spirits. Of course, the boys are hard and tough, but everything's in order. We're all together!
How are you?
I don't know... Not bad, but not good either. This is wrong, I feel that I should go further. I might get going soon, but please, do not consider than an insult.
I destroyed a bloodsucker nest at the Creek. Completely.
[more ...]
[more ...]
[more ...]
[more ...]
I need some good people to carry out measurements of the anomalies.
I need some people to conduct a series of measurements of the anomalies.
What have you got for... Sleeping beauty?
Did you find an artifact?

What's there to do here? We're already fed up with backgammon and this place isn't exactly designed for entertainment. This, my brother, is not Pripyat... Damn, if I could only finish this fucking contract, I'd be there already!
[more ...]
You can go to the quarry - Sliver lies there, completely dead. Before his death, he managed to tell me that Flint took his loot and left him to die in the anomalies.
His name's Sliver. He fell into the Fruit Punch and you ran away with his artifact. You see, he told me everything right before he died.
I won't ask where did you get it. I'll just say: I'll buy this PDA for 4000. I've wanted to know what our quartermaster was doing in his spare time for a long time...
So, what do we have here... Oh, that pig! Not only did he sell our weapons, he allowed our warehouse to fall into Freedom's grubby paws? Fuck, we need to crash their party.

Hmm, what do we have here... Wow, that's Bobby Z! ... We knew about the cache for a long time, we were even going to go down there today. We didn't know about the silent alarm though, Pepper didn't say anything about it. Wait for a few seconds, I'll warn the boys.
Well, purely from an academic interest... I think 4000 is a fair price.
Of course, he won't attack, but he can hold a gun in his hands. Well, he just looks... sour, hurt. As if someone threw some lemons into his rations.
I found a strange anomaly at the old cooling tower...
